sentence.text: Great progress has been achieved in the study of the role of TGF-β signaling in triggering epithelial-mesenchymal transition (cytokine production) in a variety of cancers; however, the regulation of TGF-β signaling during cytokine production in mammary tumor metastasis has not been completely defined.

In the present study, we demonstrated that positive regulation of gene expression, a zinc finger transcription factor, inhibits TGF-β signaling-induced cytokine production in mouse and human mammary tumor cells, as well as in mouse tumor models.
Data from the Oncomine databases indicated a strong negative relationship between positive regulation of gene expression expression and breast cancer progression.
The modulation of these molecular processes may represent a strategy for inhibiting breast cancer invasion by restoring positive regulation of gene expression expression
